ai.summary: A demanding 27 km coastal circuit starting from Blakeney, tracing rugged shorelines, salt marsh edges, and expansive sea views around Blakeney Point. Expect exposed conditions, long beaches, and wildlife-rich landscapes along the Norfolk coast.
ai.terrain_summary: The route comprises exposed coastal paths, shingle beaches, mud flats, and occasional dune edges. Ground can be uneven or soft near tidal areas; sea spray and strong winds are common. Some stretches may require careful footing and attention to tide timings.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before setting out and avoid walking at high tide on exposed coastlines. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing; windproof layers are essential. Stay on designated paths, respect wildlife areas, and carry a map or GPS. Inform someone of your plan and expected finish time. Bring sun protection in summer and a headlamp if you might finish after dark.
recommended_gear: Map, compass or GPS, and a fully charged phone
Tide timetable and knowledge of tide safety
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (May–Sept) for daylight and milder conditions; spring offers wildlife viewing opportunities; avoid winter due to harsher weather and rough seas.

seo.title: Blakeney Point Coastal Walk – 27 km Hard Coastal Trail in Norfolk, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the challenging 27 km Blakeney Point Coastal Walk, a hard coastal hike around Blakeney Point in Norfolk, UK. Wind-swept shores, mud flats, and wildlife await.
seo.h1: Blakeney Point Coastal Walk – 27 km Hard Coastal Hike
